body.p: Interpret the meaning of the p-value as a probability statement that relates to this scenario.

part.hint: An accurate and precise interpretation of the p-value will include the following ideas stated using specifics from the scenario and Minitab printout: (1) The p-value is a probability. (2) The probability is based on the assumption that H0 is true. (3) A statement about the test statistic or sample proportion being more extreme than what we observed in the data (use Ha to be more precise about the meaning of "more extreme").

Creating graphs from the Minitab info may be helpful. To describe the p-value, describe the values (p-hat or test statistic) in the shaded area. Be sure to note that your description is based on assuming that H0 is true (that the sampling distribution is centered at p = 0.55).

explanation.p: Here are several ways you could describe the p-value:
This p-value of 0.024 tells us that it is very unlikely to get data like those observed, assuming H0 is true. (This is the least precise description of the four given here.)
The p-value is the probability of observing a test statistic as large as 1.98 or larger, assuming H0 is true.
The p-value is the probability of observing a sample proportion that is 1.98 standard deviations or more above p0 = 0.55, assuming that the true population proportion is 0.55.
The p-value is the probability of observing a sample proportion of 0.608 or higher in a random sample of size 293 when the true population proportion is 0.55.
Check your response to make sure it includes the following elements:
(b) The probability is based on the assumption that H0 is true.
(c) A statement about the test statistic or sample proportion being higher than (since Ha contains ">") what we observed in the data.
